intro: Elatostema pachyceras var. majus, commonly known as the large-leaf elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its thick, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. This variant is distinguished by its larger leaf size compared to other varieties within the species.
